se.westpay.posapplib

Interface PaymentTerminal

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CarbonTerminal

    public interface PaymentTerminal
    The PaymentTerminal interface is the main interaction point with the payment terminal.

    The POS application should perform these steps in order to use the payment terminal:

    1. Get an instance of PaymentTerminal. This is done by creating an instance of CarbonTerminal and setting that up.
    2. Initialise the payment terminal by calling initialise.
    3. When the terminal is initialised, it is ready to receive transaction requests. The POS application should call doTransaction when it needs to perform a transaction.

    The methods of PaymentTerminal works asynchronously. They return immediately, and the result of the operation is returned later in a callback that must be passed to the method.

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        boolean initialise(TerminalSettings settings,
                   InitialisationResponseHandler response,
                   NotificationHandler notification)
        Initialises the payment terminal. Before the payment terminal can be used to process transactions, it has to be initialised. The initialisation process includes contacting the payment processor and downloading the current terminal settings.

        This method returns immediately but the initialisation result is returned in the response callback. The initialisation takes a little time, from a few seconds to a couple of minutes, depending on network availability and if there are new settings or updates to process.

        The initialisation is done in the background. The payment application will not take over the screen during this time.

        Parameters:
        settings - The settings for the payment terminal.
        response - A callback that will be called with the result of the initialisation.
        notification - Optional. A callback that will be called for different events.
        Returns:
        true if the request was sent successfully, otherwise false. Note that this does not indicate the success or failure of the initialisation. If no InitialisationResponseHandler is provided the method will return false.

      • doTransaction

        boolean doTransaction(TransactionRequest transaction,
                      TransactionResponseHandler response,
                      CardVerificationHandler cardCheck)
        Performs a transaction. A transaction request is passed to the payment application which will process the transaction. At the end of the transaction, regardless of outcome, the result is passed back to the POS application using the response callback.

        The payment application will take over the screen during the transaction. At the end of the transaction, when the response callback is called, the POS application has to start the appropriate activity to take the screen back.

        It is very important that the POS application remains inactive during a transaction. If the payment application loses focus during a transaction, the transaction will be aborted. The API will refuse to process new request while there is an active transaction.

        Parameters:
        transaction - The details of the transaction.
        response - A callback that will be called with the result of the transaction.
        cardCheck - Optional.
        Returns:
        true if the request was sent successfully, otherwise false.. Note that this does not indicate the success or failure of the transaction. If no TransactionResponseHandler is provided the method will return false.

      • abortTransaction

        void abortTransaction()
        Aborts a transaction in progress. An abort-transaction request is sent to the payment application. If there is no active transaction the request is ignored. If there is an active transaction the payment application will attempt to abort it.

        Note that this method does not provide a result. If the abortion is successful, it will be indicated in the response to doTransaction that the transaction was cancelled.

      • setTransactionAmounts

        boolean setTransactionAmounts(TransactionAmounts transactionAmounts)
        If a zero amount is provided in the transaction request, this call can be used to update the transaction with an amount.
        Parameters:
        transactionAmounts -
        Returns:
        true if the set transaction amount was sent successfully, otherwise false..

      • reverseLastTransaction

        boolean reverseLastTransaction(ReversalResponseHandler response)
        Reverses the previous transaction. A reversal request is sent to the payment application which will attempt to reverse the previous transaction. Note that this is not the same as aborting an active transaction. Reversing a transaction is done after the transaction has been completed. It is not possible to reverse a transaction while it is being processed.

        The payment application will take over the screen during the reversal. At the end of the transaction, when the response callback is called, the POS application has to start the appropriate activity to take the screen back.

        It is very important that the POS application remains inactive during a reversal. If the payment application loses focus during a reversal, the reversal will be aborted. The API will refuse to process new request while there is an active reversal.

        Parameters:
        response - A callback that will be called when the reversal is completed.
        Returns:
        true if the request was sent successfully, otherwise false.. Note that this does not indicate the success or failure of the reversal. If no ReversalResponseHandler is provided the method will return false.

      • getLastTransactionResult

        boolean getLastTransactionResult(TransactionResponseHandler response)
        Gets the result of the last completed transaction. The response will contain the same data as the original response to doTransaction(TransactionRequest, TransactionResponseHandler, CardVerificationHandler).

        The response can be null if the result of the previous transaction is not available. This happens if there has not been a previous transaction, or if a new transaction has been started, but not completed.

        Note that this method cannot be called while a transaction is in progress. If it is called then, it will return false.

        This method requires Westpay Payment Application v2.0.11 or higher.

        Parameters:
        response - A callback that will be called with the results of the last completed transaction. This response contains the same data that is contained in the transaction response. If the callback is not given, the method returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the request was sent successfully, otherwise false.

      • doMaintenance

        boolean doMaintenance(MaintenanceResponseHandler response)
        Open the system menu in the payment terminal. The payment terminal will take over the screen and show its System functions menu. When the user exits the menu, response callback is called and the POS application should start the appropriate activity to take over.
        Parameters:
        response - A callback that will be called when the maintenance is completed.
        Returns:
        true if the request was sent successfully, otherwise false.. Note that this does not indicate the success or failure of the maintenance. If no MaintenanceResponseHandler is provided the method will return false.

      • startPrintJob

        PrintJob startPrintJob()
        Starts a new printer job.
        Returns:
        A printer job instance, or null if a printer job cannot be started at this moment.

      • getPrinterStatus

        PrinterStatus getPrinterStatus()
        Returns:
        The current printer status.

      • validateMerchantPassword

        boolean validateMerchantPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Validate the merchant password.
        Parameters:
        password - The password in plain text.
        Returns:
        true if the validation was successfully, otherwise false..

      • checkForUpdates

        boolean checkForUpdates(UpdateCheckResponseHandler response)
        Checks for updates to the payment terminal. Calling this method will start the Application Updater program. NOTE! The Application Updater will restart the terminal when it is finished so the POS application will not regain control after this method is called.
        Parameters:
        response - Not used, reserved for future use.
        Returns:
        true if the Application Updater was started, otherwise false.. If no UpdateCheckResponseHandler is provided the method will return false.

      • shutdown

        boolean shutdown(boolean restart)
        Shuts down the payment terminal.
        Parameters:
        restart - If set to true, the terminal will restart after shut down.
        Returns:
        true if the request was sent successfully, otherwise false.. Note that this does not indicate the success or failure of the shutdown. If no TerminalStatusResponseHandler is provided the method will return false.

      • getTerminalStatus

        boolean getTerminalStatus(TerminalStatusResponseHandler response)

      • enableNavigationBar

        boolean enableNavigationBar(NavigationBarButtons[] buttons)
        Show the navigation bar with back and/or home buttons. This method will add the provided buttons to the navigation bar, that means that if the HOME button already been enabled by another activity and the provided button is BACK for this activity, both buttons will be shown. Hiding the navigation bar can be done by using the Android API method View.setSystemUiVisibility with the flags View.SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_HIDE_NAVIGATION and View.SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_IMMERSIVE_STICKY int the application.
        Parameters:
        buttons - Buttons to be enabled on the navigation bar.
        Returns:
        true if operation was successful, otherwise false..
        See Also:
        setSystemUiVisibility

        NOTE: This method (enableNavigationBar) should not be used together with disableNavigationBar in the same activity, this will cause a RuntimeException.

      • disableNavigationBar

        boolean disableNavigationBar()
        Makes the navigation bar disappear.

        NOTE: This method (disableNavigationBar) should not be used together with enableNavigationBar in the same activity, this will cause a RuntimeException.

        Returns:
        true if operation was successful, otherwise false..

        Parameters:

        value - Parameter value.
        Returns:
        true if the timeout was successfully set, otherwise false..

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        boolean - True success, false otherwise.
